Featured Birds

The Bird Nerds think that all birds are cool but every few months we pick a species and showcase it. Every bird we choose includes some neat facts. Here is the list of previously featured birds:

–Featured Bird–

Sharp-tailed Grouse

  1. Sharp-tailed grouse are related to 'prairie chickens' but often get mislabeled.
  2. Males display to attract females on communal dancing grounds called leks.
  3. Sometimes referred to as fire grouse or fire bird by Native Americans.

–Featured Bird–

Downy Woodpecker

  1. It is the smallest woodpecker in North America.
  2. About a quarter of their diet consists of plant material, particularly berries, acorns, and grains.
  3. Its sound is an excited string of hoarse, high-pitched notes.

–Featured Bird–

Tundra Swan

  1. It is larger than a snow goose; smaller than a trumpeter swan.
  2. The high-pitched, quivering oo-oo-whoo is constantly repeated by migrating flocks.
  3. It is one of the top 10 largest birds in Alberta.
